# 1886 Chicago White Stockings season

| league_place = 1st
| owner = Albert Spalding
| manager = Cap Anson
| television =
| radio =
|}}
The 1886 Chicago White Stockings season was the 15th season of the Chicago White Stockings franchise, the 11th in the National League and the second at the first West Side Park. The White Stockings finished first in the National League with a record of 90â€“34, 2.5 games ahead of the second place Detroit Wolverines. The team was defeated four games to two by the St. Louis Browns in the 1886 World Series.

1886 World Series
The White Stockings lost the 1886 World Series to the St. Louis Browns, four games to two.

*[https://www.baseball-reference.com/teams/CHC/1886.shtml 1886 Chicago White Stockings season at Baseball Reference]
